channel.title: Visualization on A Bookworm's Paradise
channel.description: Recent content in Visualization on A Bookworm's Paradise

item.title: Data Visualization: Bar Plots
item.description: After downloading and bringing in the following packages: library(Lahman) ## Warning: package 'Lahman' was built under R version 3.4.2 library(sqldf) ## Warning: package 'sqldf' was built under R version 3.4.2 ## Loading required package: gsubfn ## Loading required package: proto ## Loading required package: RSQLite library(ggplot2) ## Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 3.4.2 Before collecting the data it is important to note the difference between a Factor and a Level.

item.title: Data Visualization: Dashboard
item.description: After installing the following packages: library(Lahman) ## Warning: package 'Lahman' was built under R version 3.4.2 library(sqldf) ## Warning: package 'sqldf' was built under R version 3.4.2 ## Loading required package: gsubfn ## Loading required package: proto ## Loading required package: RSQLite library(ggplot2) ## Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 3.4.2 library(flexdashboard) ## Warning: package 'flexdashboard' was built under R version 3.4.2 In RStudio select New File, then R Markdown file.

item.title: Data Visualization: Histograms
item.description: After downloading the following packages: library(Lahman) library(sqldf) ## Loading required package: gsubfn ## Loading required package: proto ## Loading required package: RSQLite library(ggplot2) The first step is to extract the data from Lahman. query<-"SELECT weight FROM Master" result<-sqldf(query) Now the data has been saved under results. The next step is to write the commands for visualizing the data. ggplot()+ geom_histogram(data=result,aes(x=weight)) ## `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.

item.title: Data Visualization: Time Series
item.description: After downloading and bringing in the following packages: library(Lahman) ## Warning: package 'Lahman' was built under R version 3.4.2 library(sqldf) ## Warning: package 'sqldf' was built under R version 3.4.2 ## Loading required package: gsubfn ## Loading required package: proto ## Loading required package: RSQLite library(ggplot2) ## Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 3.4.2 The first step is to extract the data from the Lahman database. query<-"SELECT yearID,HR FROM Batting WHERE playerID='ruthba01'" result<-sqldf(query) The next step now that the data is saved under results is to type the commands to visualize the data.

item.title: Data Visualization: Scatter Plots
item.description: After downloading and bringing in the following packages: library(Lahman) library(sqldf) ## Loading required package: gsubfn ## Loading required package: proto ## Loading required package: RSQLite library(ggplot2) The first step is to extract the data from the Lahman database. query<-"SELECT playerID,sum(HR) AS career_HR,sum(SO) AS career_SO FROM Batting GROUP BY playerID HAVING sum(HR)>=400" result<-sqldf(query) Now the data has been saved under the results. The next step is to write out the commands for visualizing the data.
